decks.notes: The key focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful spells, while utilizing cards like Static Prison and Unstable Amulet to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck aims to quickly build up a threatening board presence with cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Amped Raptor, supported by Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion allows for additional flexibility and consistency in the deck's mana base. Overall, the goal is to apply early pressure and maintain control throughout the game.

The main focus of this deck is to control the opponent through hand disruption, removal spells, and powerful finishers. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize, while removing threats with Fatal Push and Fell the Profane. The key win condition comes from cards like Soul Spike and Necrodominance, with powerful creatures like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse, and Grief providing additional threats. The deck also has ways to generate additional value through cards like Profane Tutor and Malakir Rebirth, making it a strong control deck in a 1 vs 1 format.

This deck focuses on quick, aggressive plays to overwhelm the opponent and deal damage as quickly as possible. It utilizes low-cost, efficient spells and creatures to maintain pressure and control the tempo of the game. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds additional flexibility and consistency to the deck. By prioritizing fast damage output and efficient card advantage, this deck aims to win the game before the opponent has a chance to establish their own strategy.

The deck focuses on generating a large amount of mana quickly through spells like Manamorphose and Rituals, with the goal of casting multiple spells in a single turn. It then aims to combo off by using Glimpse the Impossible and Past in Flames to generate additional mana and draw cards. Ral, Monsoon Mage helps with card advantage and dealing damage to the opponent. Jegantha, the Wellspring provides additional mana acceleration. The deck utilizes Ruby Storm to chain together spells and eventually win the game with a large burst of damage.

The main concept of this deck is to assemble a combination of cards that allows the player to manipulate the graveyard and then cast Living End, a powerful sorcery spell that returns all creatures from the graveyard to the battlefield. By cycling cards like Street Wraith and using cards like Architects of Will to control the opponent's topdeck, the player can set up a board state where casting Living End can swing the game heavily in their favor. The deck focuses on creating explosive turns and overwhelming the opponent with powerful creatures.

This Mardu Aggro deck focuses on fast and aggressive creature plays combined with disruption and removal spells to control the board and pressure the opponent. The deck utilizes a mix of powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Orcish Bowmasters, supported by cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to disrupt the opponent's game plan. By applying early pressure and disrupting the opponent's strategy, this deck aims to close out the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck focuses on aggressively dealing damage to the opponent as quickly as possible, utilizing low-cost spells and creatures to put pressure on the opponent early in the game. It also incorporates the companion mechanic to provide consistent access to Jegantha, the Wellspring. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of direct damage spells, creature attacks, and potentially using Underworld Breach to recur impactful spells from the graveyard. Overall, the key strategy is to maintain constant pressure and close out the game swiftly.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on quickly playing threats like Ragavan, Dragon's Rage Channeler, and Murktide Regent, while controlling the board with Counterspells and removal like Unholy Heat and Lightning Bolt. The deck aims to apply pressure on the opponent early on and disrupt their game plan with cards like Force of Negation and Subtlety. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card advantage while cards like Mishra's Bauble and Preordain help with card selection. The aim is to overwhelm the opponent with efficient threats and disruptive spells while maintaining card advantage.

This UR Control deck focuses on countering opponents' spells, controlling the board with removal and card draw, and finishing the game with powerful spells like Tune the Narrative and Galvanic Discharge. It includes cards like Counterspell, Lightning Bolt, and Snapcaster Mage to maintain control over the game. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Subtlety provide card advantage and options for disruption. The deck also includes land cards to ensure mana consistency and flexibility in casting spells. Overall, this deck aims to disrupt opponents' strategies and win through careful control and powerful spells.

This deck focuses on assembling a variety of creature toolbox options to create a powerful combo. It utilizes cards like Wall of Roots, Chord of Calling, and Finale of Devastation to tutor for specific creatures such as Springheart Nantuko, Yawgmoth, Thran Physician, and Thassa's Oracle to achieve victory. The deck also includes protective cards like Sylvan Safekeeper and Endurance to ensure the combo pieces remain safe. By utilizing a diverse range of creatures and utility lands like Boseiju, Who Endures and Okina, Temple to the Grandfathers, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a versatile strategy.

The deck focuses on ramping up and efficiently casting powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul and Ulamog using cards like Through the Breach and Ancient Stirrings. It also utilizes control elements with cards like All Is Dust and Kozilek's Command to disrupt opponent's strategies. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with big threats while maintaining control of the game. It also includes ramp and mana fixing cards like Talisman of Impulse and Eldrazi Temple to ensure consistent and powerful plays. The combination of ramp, control, and powerful creatures makes Eldrazi Control a formidable archetype in Modern 1 vs 1.

The main focus of this Jeskai Control deck is to control the board by countering spells and removing threats with removal spells like Lightning Helix, Prismatic Ending, and Wrath of the Skies. It also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck includes cards like Gifts Ungiven and Snapcaster Mage for card advantage and flexibility. The mana base is designed to support the deck's strategy, with fetchlands like Arid Mesa and Flooded Strand to fix mana and provide access to all three colors of mana.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying threats and disrupting the opponent with cards like Static Prison and Galvanic Discharge. The key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with early aggression using efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Amped Raptor, while also utilizing powerful card advantage engines such as Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker. The deck aims to maintain pressure on the opponent while controlling the board with removal and disruption, ultimately closing out the game with powerful finishers like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah.

Utilize powerful mana ramping with UrzaTron lands to quickly bring out high-cost threats like Eldrazi creatures and Planeswalkers, while controlling the board with cards like Trinisphere, Chalice of the Void, and All Is Dust. Karn, the Great Creator can search for artifact answers to various threats, while Ugin's Labyrinth and The One Ring provide additional control and disruption. The Underworld Cookbook can be used to draw cards and potentially bring back Emrakul, the World Anew. Overall, the deck aims to establish board control and overwhelm opponents with powerful late-game threats.
